awd_titl_txt: Travel: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2024 ACM SIGSIM Principles of Advanced Discrete Simulation (PADS)
awd_abstract_narration:
Modeling and simulation play pivotal roles in diverse settings, from large-scale national laboratories to industrial applications. The annual conference on Principles of Advanced Discrete Simulation (PADS) is the flagship conference of the ACM's Special Interest Group on Simulation and Modeling (SIGSIM). Aligned with NSF's mission, this conference serves as a vital platform for disseminating research, fostering connections among researchers, and training the next generation of scholars.
 
In support of national initiatives for workforce training and diversification in science, this award specifically aids graduate students in the United States attending the ACM SIGSIM PADS conference in Atlanta in June 2024, with a focus on individuals from under-represented groups. The selected students gain opportunities that enhance their career paths and provide essential tools for advancing science in both theoretical and applied research on modeling and simulation. The NSF funding significantly impacts the careers of emerging researchers in modeling and simulation, playing a pivotal role in promoting diversity within the field.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The ACM SIGSIM International Conference on Principles of Advanced Discrete Simulation (ACM SIGSIM-PADS), established in 1985, is the flagship conference of the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM)’s Special Interest Group on Simulation and Modeling (SIGSIM). The conference covers a wide range of research topics, including simulation algorithms and infrastructures, modeling methodologies, and applications of advanced discrete simulation. It brings together academic, industry, and government professionals to a highly selective forum, making it an ideal platform for those interested in technological advancements in modeling and simulation. The goal of this student support is to contribute to the training of early-career scholars in the field of Modeling and Simulation and promote research engagement of students, especially ones who are not well-funded, under-represented, or otherwise not likely to be able to attend high-profile conferences on modeling and simulation. The grant will strongly encourage these students to actively engage and take leadership roles in exploring the latest research directions in the related fields.


The grant supported five US-based Ph.D. students to attend the 2024 ACM SIGSIM-PADS conference in Atlanta, Georgia, from June 24 to June 26, 2024. The conference offers various student-centric activities, including a dedicated Ph.D. colloquium, where each student delivered an oral presentation followed by a poster session. These activities provided an excellent opportunity for students to discuss their research with established researchers in the field. The Best Ph.D. Colloquium Award was chosen by independent judges and announced during the conference award ceremony. The student engagement activities were well-received and contributed to a rewarding experience for all participants.
